page.title: 04 FARMING - MILK QUOTAS
page.content: There are 100 cows on the farm. Only 80 are giving milk at any one time. 20 are having a rest. The cows have one calf a year and give milk for 10 months with 2 months rest.{ {Each cow}gives{4000 - 6000 kgs.of milk {a year. 1 kg.= approx. 1 litre. The E.E.C.decided that{production}per farm in 1984/5 should decrease by 9% of the l983/4 production. The l985/86 quota is to be 1% lower than 1984/5 quota. For a farmer to make a{profit}the cost of production must be cut: the cost of producing one gallon has to be less. If less concentrates (extra dairy feeding) are given, each cow will produce less milk. May 1985 -{14 pence a litre}is paid to a farmer for milk which is collected by tanker.
